Name: ABAIIN Registry Entry
Comment: An entry in the ABA IIN registry, a repository of financial institution characteristics collected by the ABA for those institutions to which they issue IINS

Name: ABAIIN Registry Entry only applies To
Comment: A subtype of associative entity 'applies To' to restrict child entities for the parent, ABAIIN Registry Entry

Name: ABARTN Registry Entry
Comment: An entry in the ABA RTN registry, a repository of financial institution characteristics collected by the ABA Registrar on behalf of the ABA

Name: ABARTN Registry Entry only applies To
Comment: A subtype of associative entity 'applies To' to restrict child entities for the parent, ABARTN Registry Entry

Name: Absolute Prepayment Rate
Comment: Measure of the monthly rate of loan prepayments as a percentage of the original pool balance

Name: Account
Comment: Container for records associated with a business arrangement for regular transactions and services

Name: Account As An Asset
Comment: Financial asset in the form of an account

Name: Account Change Notification Obligation
Comment: Obligation to notify a counterparty of any changes in account details

Name: Account Holder
Comment: Party that owns an account

Name: Account Identifier
Comment: Identifier that denotes an account

Name: Account Ownership
Comment: Holding of an account

Name: Account Provider
Comment: Party that provides and services an account

Name: Account Specific Service Agreement
Comment: Service-agreement that is account-specific, applicable in cases where a client might hold multiple accounts with differing terms and conditions

Name: Account Statement
Comment: Periodic summary of account activity for a given period of time

Name: Accounting Framework
Comment: Framework, including policies, methods, rules, and processes, used to measure, recognize, present, and disclose the information appearing in an entity's financial statements, and, from a legal ownership perspective, that is applied for accounting consolidation determination

Name: Accounting Transaction
Comment: Event recognized by an entry in the records of an account

Name: Accrual
Comment: The process of accumulating interest or other income that has been earned but not paid

Name: Accrued Interest
Comment: Amount of interest that has been incurred, as of a specific date, on a loan or other financial obligation but has not yet been paid out

Name: Action
Comment: Event announced, initiated or carried out by an organization that affects a legal entity or the securities it issues and may have a material impact on that entity's stakeholders, such as shareholders and creditors

Name: Action Classification Scheme
Comment: Scheme for classifying the kinds of actions and events that may be announced, initiated or carried out by an organization that affects a legal entity or the securities it issues

Name: Action Classification Scheme only has Member (cmns)
Comment: A subtype of associative entity 'has Member (cmns)' to restrict child entities for the parent, Action Classification Scheme

Name: Action Classifier
Comment: Classifier that distinguishes the kinds of actions and events that may be announced, initiated or carried out by an organization that affects a legal entity or the securities it issues, such as income-oriented events

Name: Action Status
Comment: State of some action at some point in time

Name: Actor
Comment: Primary performer in a relationship between parties, i.e., the party that does something, causes something to happen, or otherwise plays an agentive role in the relationship

Name: acts In
Comment: Indicates a situation in which the actor plays a primary role

Name: acts On
Comment: Relates an actor in a given situation to the undergoer that they affect under the circumstances

Name: Ad Hoc Schedule
Comment: Schedule consisting of some number of individual events that are not necessarily recurring

Name: Ad Hoc Schedule Entry
Comment: Entry, including a date or date and time, among multiple non-regularly-recurring entries in a schedule

Name: Address
Comment: Index to a location to which communications may be delivered

Name: Address Component
Comment: Aspect of an address

Name: Addressing Scheme
Comment: System for allocating addresses to objects

Name: Addressing Scheme only defines
Comment: A subtype of associative entity 'defines' to restrict child entities for the parent, Addressing Scheme

Name: Adjustable Rate Dividend
Comment: Dividend that varies with a benchmark

Name: Adjusted Closing Price
Comment: Amended closing price to reflect a security's value after accounting for any corporate actions, such as stock splits, dividends, and rights offerings

Name: Administrative Agent
Comment: Role of a financial institution (often one of the primary lenders in the syndicate) designated to act as an intermediary between the borrowers and the syndicate lenders

Name: Adult
Comment: Person who has attained the age of majority as defined in some jurisdiction

Name: advises
Comment: Provides counsel or guidance to

Name: Affiliate
Comment: Party that is related to a legal entity, directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, and controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with that entity, typically determined by the degree of ownership

Name: Affiliation
Comment: Situation in which a controlled party is affiliated with a controlling party for some period of time

Name: Age
Comment: Length of time that something or someone has been alive or existed

Name: Age Of Majority
Comment: Age at which someone acquires the rights and responsibilities of an adult in some jurisdiction

Name: Agency Agreement
Comment: Agreement that designates a party as a registered agent to represent and act on behalf of another

Name: Agency Of A Foreign Banking Organization
Comment: Place of business of a foreign bank, located in any state, at which credit balances are maintained, checks are paid, money is lent, or, to the extent not prohibited by state or federal law, deposits are accepted from a person or entity that is not a citizen or resident of the United States

Name: Agent
Comment: Something autonomous that can adapt to and interact with its environment

Name: Agent For Service Of Process
Comment: Registered agent (person or organization) designated by a business entity, such as a corporation, to receive legal correspondence on behalf of the business entity in the jurisdiction in which the agent's address is located

Name: Agent Role
Comment: Role played by any agent

Name: Agreement
Comment: Negotiated understanding between two or more parties, reflecting the offer and acceptance of commitments on the part of either party

Name: Agreement Corporation
Comment: Corporation chartered by a state to engage in international banking, so named because the corporation enters into an 'agreement' with the Fed's Board of Governors that it will limit its activities to those permitted

Name: Agreement Corporation-Banking
Comment: Agreement corporation whose charter allows the corporation to engage in international banking

Name: Agreement Corporation-Investment
Comment: Agreement corporation whose charter allows the corporation to engage in international investment banking

Name: Agricultural Resource
Comment: Negotiable commodity that is obtained via some agricultural process, including forestry, fishing, livestock, grain, dairy, corn, cocoa, soybeans, sugar, coffee

Name: Aligned Community Investment Fund
Comment: Community investment fund that raises capital publicly from community members and deploys some of that capital via investments into its client businesses or other businesses in the community

Name: Allotment Right
Comment: Privileges allotted to existing security holders, entitling them to receive new securities free of charge

Name: Allotment Right Formula
Comment: Rule applied to calculate the number of securities for an allotment right, typically based on the number of these instruments that the holder holds

Name: Alpha2 Code (cr)
Comment: A digraph representing a country or geographic region

Name: Alpha2 Code (Ir)
Comment: A language identifier for a human language as defined by ISO 639-1, that is, a two-letter combination of characters used to represent a language or languages

Name: Alpha3 Code (cr)
Comment: A trigraph representing a country or geographic region

Name: Alpha3 Code (Ir)
Comment: A language identifier for a human language as defined by ISO 639, that is, a three-letter combination of characters used to represent a language or languages

Name: Alternative Trading System
Comment: Trading venue that is more loosely regulated than a regulated exchange

Name: American Depositary Receipt
Comment: Depositary receipt that represents securities of a foreign company and allows that company's securities to trade in the U.S. financial markets

Name: American Depositary Receipt Level
Comment: Classifier for American depositary receipts that categorizes ADRs into levels based on the extent to which the foreign company has access to the U.S. market

Name: American Depositary Receipt Level Scheme
Comment: Classifier for American depositary receipts that categorizes ADRs into levels based on the extent to which the foreign company has access to the U.S. market

Name: American Exercise Terms
Comment: Exercise terms that stipulate that an option may be exercised on or before the date of expiration

Name: American Statistics Publisher
Comment: Statistical information publisher comprised of the government agencies and departments that publish statistical information on behalf of the U.S. Federal Government

Name: Amortization
Comment: The process of reduction of debt or other costs through periodic charges to assets or liabilities, such as through principal payments on mortgages

Name: Amortization Schedule
Comment: Schedule of periodic payments (repayment installments) that specify changes in the balance of the debt over time

Name: Amortizing Bond
Comment: Bond that regularly pays down the principal (face value) on the debt along with its interest expense over the life of the bond

Name: Amount Of Money
Comment: Amount of readily available cash in banknotes and coins

Name: Anchor Date
Comment: Fixed reference point within a series or timeline

Name: Ancient Language
Comment: An extinct language that has an attested literature and is recognized as having special status in the academic community

Name: Annualized Standard Deviation
Comment: Standard deviation for some measure over a specific reference period

Name: applies Methodology
Comment: Indicates the strategy used for the purposes of determining the fair market or present value of something

Name: applies To
Comment: Indicates something for which a context is material, germane, or relevant in some way

Name: applies To Account
Comment: Indicates the account to which the transaction record or individual transaction applies

Name: Appraisal
Comment: Written estimate of the market value of something as of some point in time, typically provided by a qualified appraiser

Name: Appraised Value
Comment: Estimated value of some asset as of a given point in time

Name: Appraiser
Comment: Party that evaluates or estimates the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something

Name: Approved Publication Arrangement
Comment: Data reporting services provider that is authorized to provide the service of publishing certain trade reports on behalf of banks, investment firms, or asset management companies

Name: Approved Reporting Mechanism
Comment: Data reporting services provider that is authorized to provide the service of reporting details of transactions to competent authorities or ESMA (the European Securities and Markets Authority) on behalf of investment firms

Name: Arbitrary Unit
Comment: Arbitrarily defined unit of measurement, where a relation of the unit to a physical unit of the Sl does not exist or is unknown

Name: Arithmetic Mean
Comment: Sum of a collection of numbers divided by the number of numbers in the collection

Name: Arrangement (cmns)
Comment: Systematic plan, manner, or method for making, doing, achieving, or organizing something

Name: Arrangement (Icc)
Comment: A structure or means of organizing information such as a schema, numbering system, organization scheme, measurement system, taxonomy, or language for organizing information

Name: Articles Of Incorporation
Comment: Contract that establishes a new corporation or, when amended, adjusts the legal basis for the corporation, and outlines basic information about the corporation, including the type of business, and a description of the business' operational characteristics

Name: Artificial Language
Comment: A language for human communication that has been artificially devised

Name: Asian Option
Comment: Option whose exercise terms involve a payoff determined by the average underlying price (either the strike price or the settlement price) of the underlying asset over a predetermined period

Name: Asian Option Classifier
Comment: Financial instrument classifier that classifies Asian options based on whether they are rate-based or price based

Name: Aspect
Comment: Characteristic or feature that can be used to dimensionalize, filter, or subset a class, collection, or set of things

Name: Assessment Activity
Comment: Activity involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something

Name: Assessment Boundary
Comment: Defined scope, limits, and criteria used to determine what is included or excluded in an evaluation, analysis, or measurement of environmental impacts, sustainability performance, or related objectives

Name: Assessment Event
Comment: Event involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something

Name: Assessment Report
Comment: Report that includes an opinion, judgement, appraisal, or view about something and typically the methodology and raw inputs used to arrive at that opinion

Name: Asset
Comment: Something of monetary value that is owned or provides benefit to some party

Name: Asset Backed Credit Default Swap
Comment: Credit default swap whose underlying reference obligation is an asset-backed security rather than corporate credit

Name: Asset Backed Security
Comment: Debt instrument backed by receivables other than those arising out of real estate loans or mortgages

Name: Asset Class
Comment: Financial instrument classifier for a group of securities that exhibit similar characteristics, behave similarly in the marketplace and are subject to the same laws and regulations

Name: Assignable Contract
Comment: Contract in which contract holder (assignor) may transfer some or all of their rights and obligations to another party (assignee)

Name: Association
Comment: Notfor-profit organization that is owned by and acts on behalf of its members

Name: Attachment Point
Comment: Lower tranche boundary of a tranche defined as a percentage of the value of the total pool of collateral, either at issuance or as of some point in time

Name: Auction Date Rule
Comment: Business recurrence interval convention that is a published rule for defining the date of some auction event

Name: Auction Market
Comment: Exchange in which buyers and sellers submit competitive bids that do not involve direct negotiations between parties, as part of an auction scheduled either on demand or on a periodic basis

Name: Auction Rate Dividend
Comment: Preferred share dividend whose rate is periodically reset through an auction, typically every 7, 14, 28, or 35 days

Name: Auditor
Comment: Party qualified and authorized to review and verify the accuracy of financial records and ensure that companies comply with tax laws

Name: Authorization
Comment: Situation in which a party authorizes someone to act on their behalf under certain conditions for some period of time

Name: Authorized Party
Comment: Party that has been given the responsibility to act on behalf of another party under some set of guidelines

Name: authorizes
Comment: Endorses, enables, ernpowers, or gives permission to

Name: authorizes Through
Comment: Indicates the situation that facilitates designation of an authorized party by the authorizing party for some purpose

Name: Authorizing Party
Comment: Party that delegates some role, authority, or control to another party

Name: Auto Asset Backed Security
Comment: Asset-backed security that is backed by an underlying pool of auto-related loans and/or leases

Name: Auto Debt Pool
Comment: Debt pool of loans and/or leases that are motor vehicle-related

Name: Automated System
Comment: System that reduces or eliminates the need for human involvement in order to complete a task

Name: Average Absolute Deviation
Comment: Average of the absolute deviations from a central point

Name: Average Daily Earnings
Comment: Measure of the average daily wage an employee makes over the reporting period

Name: Average Earnings
Comment: Measure of the average wage an hourly or salaried worker makes in a given period of time

Name: Average Hourly Earnings
Comment: Measure of the average hourly wage an employee makes over the reporting period

Name: Average Monthly Earnings
Comment: Measure of the average monthly wage an employee makes over the reporting period

Name: Average Weekly Earnings
Comment: Measure of the average weekly wage an employee makes over the reporting period

Name: Averaging Strategy
Comment: Method used for calculating the average rate or price of an Asian option

Name: Balance
Comment: Amount of money available or owed

Name: Bank
Comment: Depository institution, usually a corporation, that accepts deposits, makes loans, pays checks, and performs related services, for individual members of the public, businesses or other organizations

Name: Bank Account Identifier
Comment: Identifier that identifies a demand deposit account provided by a bank

Name: Bank Holding Company
Comment: Any company that owns and/or has direct or indirect control of one or more banks; BHCs may also own nonbanking subsidiaries such as broker-dealers and asset managers

Name: Bank Identifier
Comment: Identifier that uniquely identifies the financial institution and, when appropriate, the branch of that financial institution servicing an account

Name: Bankers Acceptance
Comment: Short-term debt instrument that is guaranteed and paid by a bank and used as a relatively safe form of payment for large transactions

Name: Bankers Bank
Comment: Commercial bank owned exclusively (except to the extent directors' qualifying shares are required by law) by other depository institutions or depository institution holding companies, the activities of which are limited by its articles of association exclusively to providing services to or for other depository institutions, their holding companies, and the officers, directors, and employees of such institutions and companies, and to providing correspondent banking services at the request of other depository institutions or their holding companies

Name: Bankers Bank Not Subject To Reserve Requirements
Comment: Bankers' bank whose activities are not limited by specific requirements of the Federal Reserve

Name: Bankers Bank Subject To Reserve Requirements
Comment: Bankers' bank whose activities are limited by specific requirements of the Federal Reserve

Name: Banking Product
Comment: Product provided to consumers and businesses by a depository institution

Name: Banking Service
Comment: Financial service offered by a depository institution

Name: Bankruptcy
Comment: Credit event involving a change in state or condition in which a party becomes insolvent

Name: Barrier Capital Protection Certificate
Comment: Capital-protected product whose protection is defined as a percentage of the nominal price (e.g. 100 percent), with minimum redemption at expiry equivalent to the capital protection

Name: Barrier Discount Certificate
Comment: Participation certificate that enables the investor to acquire the underlying asset at a lower price in return for a limited payout, and for which the maximum redemption amount (Cap) is paid out if the barrier is never breached

Name: Barrier Instrument Based Mini Future Certificate
Comment: Mini-future certificate that immediately expires if the barrier instrument trading price level is breached during product lifetime

Name: Barrier Option
Comment: Option whose final exercise depends upon the path taken by the price of an underlying instrument, i.e., whose payoff depends on whether or not the underlying asset has reached or exceeded a predetermined price

Name: Barrier Reverse Convertible Certificate
Comment: Participation certificate whose payout is conditional: should the barrier never be breached, the nominal price plus coupon is paid at redemption; if the barrier is breached the product changes into a reverse convertible

Name: Barrier Underlying Mini Future Certificate
Comment: Mini-future certificate that immediately expires if the barrier underlying level is breached during product lifetime

Name: Base Metal
Comment: Common metal that tarnishes, oxidizes, or corrodes relatively quickly when exposed to air or moisture, that is widely used in commercial and industrial applications, such as construction and manufacturing

Name: Base Quantity Kind
Comment: Quantity in a conventionally chosen subset of a given system of quantities, where no quantity in the subset can be expressed in terms of the other quantities within that subset

Name: Base Rate
Comment: Basic rate of interest on which the actual rate a bank charges on loans to its customers is calculated

Name: Base Unit
Comment: Measurement unit that is defined by a system of units to be the reference measurement unit for a base quantity

Name: Basel III Designation
Comment: European Union wide securities designation, defined by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS), that classifies securities based on the quality of capital underlying the instrument

Name: Basic Bank Account Identifier
Comment: Identifier that uniquely identifies an individual account at a specific financial institution in a particular country and which includes a bank identifier of the financial institution servicing that account

Name: Basis Swap
Comment: Swap in which payment streams are referenced to different bases

Name: Basket
Comment: Collection of goods, services, or other things (e.g., financial contracts) that can be purchased and sold in some marketplace

Name: Basket Certificate
Comment: Certificate whose underlying asset represents a fraction of a basket of securities that corresponds to the subscription ratio

Name: Basket Constituent
Comment: Component of a basket

Name: Basket Credit Default Swap
Comment: Credit default swap that references a bespoke, synthetic portfolio of underlying assets whose components have been agreed to for a specific OTC derivative by the parties to the transaction

Name: Basket Future
Comment: Futures contract whose underlying asset is a basket of securities and/or indices

Name: Basket Of Commodities
Comment: Custom basket whose constituents consist of one or more negotiable commodities

Name: Basket Of Credit Default Swaps
Comment: Basket of reference obligations are credit default swap instruments

Name: Basket Of Credit Risks
Comment: Basket of instruments, legal entities, or a combination thereof collected for the purpose of analyzing risk

Name: Basket Of Debt Instruments
Comment: Basket of securities whose constituents are debt instruments

Name: Basket Of Equities
Comment: Basket of securities whose constituents are listed shares

Name: Basket Of Indices
Comment: Basket composed of market indices

Name: Basket Of Indices Constituent
Comment: Single constituent of a basket of indices

Name: Basket Of Indices Constituent only comprises
Comment: A subtype of associative entity 'comprises' to restrict child entities for the parent, Basket Of Indices Constituent

Name: Basket Of Securities
Comment: Basket composed of securities, typically of a particular asset class such as equities or bonds

Name: Basket Option
Comment: Option whose underlying asset is a group, or basket, of commodities, securities, indices, or currencies

Name: Basket Warrant
Comment: Warrant that permits the holder to acquire a package or group of assets at a specified price during a specified period

Name: Beneficial Owner
Comment: Party that enjoys the benefits of ownership (such as receipt of income) of something even though its ownership (title) may be in the name of another party (called a nominee or registered owner)

Name: Beneficial Ownership
Comment: Situation linking party that enjoys the benefits of ownership (such as receipt of income) of something even though its ownership (title) may be in the name of another party (called a nominee or registered owner) to the asset that they own

Name: Beneficiary
Comment: Party that receives some benefit or advantage or profits from something

Name: Benefit Corporation
Comment: Not-for-profit corporation set up under specific state legislation, typically to provide some social benefit, without an obligation to maximize shareholder return

Name: Bermudan Exercise Terms
Comment: Exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised on predetermined dates within some exercise window, often on one day each month or at the date of expiration

Name: Best Bid
Comment: Highest bid price a prospective buyer is willing to pay at a particular time for a given security

Name: Best Efforts Offering
Comment: Securities offering whereby investment bankers commit to doing their best to sell the securities offered, but do not assume the full risk of an underwriter

Name: Best Offer
Comment: Lowest price acceptable to a prospective seller for a given security at a particular point in time

Name: Bibliographic Citation
Comment: A reference to an authoritative source for provenance or substatiation purposes; The form of bibliographic citation may be specific to a domain, publication, or community, thus specific properties to define the details are not provided. FRBR, ISO 690, and others provide reasonable approaches if none is explicitly required for a specification.

Name: Bibliographic Code
Comment: An alpha-3 code that is a member of the set of bibliographic codes in ISO 639-2

Name: Bid Ask Spread
Comment: Difference between an offer (ask) price and a bid price

Name: Bid Price
Comment: Price a prospective buyer is willing to pay

Name: Bilateral Agreement
Comment: Agreement where two parties commit to perform specific actions or obligations towards each other

Name: Bilateral Contract
Comment: Contract where two parties commit to perform specific actions or obligations towards each other

Name: Bilateral Netting Provision
Comment: Netting provision that occurs between two parties, in which mutual obligations are offset to determine a single net payment

Name: Bill Of Exchange
Comment: Short-term negotiable financial instrument consisting of an order in writing addressed by one person (the seller of goods) to another (the buyer), requiring the latter to pay a fixed amount of money on demand (a sight draft) or on a predetermined date (a time draft)

Name: Birth Certificate
Comment: An original document certifying the circumstances of the birth, or a certified copy of or representation of the ensuing registration of that birth

Name: Birth Certificate Identification Scheme
Comment: System for allocating identifiers to birth certificates

Name: Birth Certificate Identifier
Comment: Identifier associated with a vital record documenting the birth of a child

Name: Blue Sky Law
Comment: State-level securities regulation, designed to protect investors against securities fraud that require issuers to be registered and to disclose details of their offerings

Name: Board Agreement
Comment: Formal, legally binding agreement between members of the Board of Directors of the organization

Name: Board Capacity
Comment: Authority to act in a fiduciary capacity with respect to the organization, including but not limited to determining and executing corporate policy

Name: Board Composition Control
Comment: Situation in which a voting shareholder, entity owner, or some other party in the case of a not-for-profit organization, appoints and/or nominates someone to the board of directors of an organization for some period of time

Name: Board Member
Comment: Party that has fiduciary responsibility with respect to the organization, including but not limited to determining and executing corporate policy

Name: Board Membership
Comment: Situation relating an individual member of the board of directors to the organization

Name: Board Of Directors
Comment: Group of people comprising the governing body of an organization that has the authority to set organizational strategy and policies as well as to select and, to some degree manage, leadership

Name: Bond
Comment: Tradable debt instrument representing a loan in which the issuer owes the holder(s) a debt

Name: Bond Amortization Payment Terms
Comment: Terms that include a schedule for repayment of the principal over the lifetime of the bond, typically in equal payments at regular intervals

Name: Bond Conversion Terms
Comment: Terms indicating when a convertible bond can be converted to another security (usually a publicly traded share issued by of the same issuer)

Name: Bond Coupon
Comment: Interest rate on a debt security that the issuer promises to pay to the holder until maturity, expressed as an annual percentage of the face value

Name: Bond Future
Comment: Futures contract whose underlying asset is at least one bond

Name: Bond Insurance
Comment: Insurance policy that a bond issuer purchases that guarantees the repayment of the principal and all associated interest payments to the bondholders in the event of default

Name: Bond Option
Comment: Option giving the buyer (holder) the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell (depending on whether it is a call or a put) a bond at a certain price on or before a specified date

Name: Bond Pool
Comment: Debt pool of consisting of bonds

Name: Bond Principal Repayment Terms
Comment: Terms for the repayment of the principal on a bond

Name: Bond Purchase Right
Comment: Purchase right that gives a prospective acquiree's bondholders the right to buy bonds of the firm or bonds of anyone who acquires the firm at a deep discount to their fair market value

Name: Bond Registrar
Comment: Party responsible for maintaining records on behalf of the issuer that identify the owners of a registered bond issue

Name: Bond Subscription Right
Comment: Subscription right entitling existing bond holders to subscribe to new securities at a price normally lower than the prevailing market price

Name: Bond Variable Coupon
Comment: Bond coupon that has a variable interest rate

Name: Bond With Partial Call
Comment: Bond with a feature whereby the issue can be partially called for amounts that are at the discretion of the issuer

Name: Bond With Published Sinking Fund
Comment: Bond whereby amortization is via a known and published schedule

Name: Bond With Warrant
Comment: Bond that is issued together with one or more warrant(s) attached as part of the offer, the warrant(s) granting the holder the right to purchase a designated security, often the common stock of the issuer.

Name: Book Entry Settlement
Comment: Settlement in which all transactions are processed via electronic book entries rather than the physical exchange of security certificates or other documentation

Name: Book Value Per Share
Comment: The amount of the shareholders' equity (total assets minus total liabilities) that each common share would receive if the company were liquidated

Name: Booking Method
Comment: Method that determines the location of the legal or other record of a trade, which in the case of some derivative instruments may be different from the physical trading location

Name: Border Control Checkpoint
Comment: Place where border inspections are carried out

Name: Broker Dealer
Comment: Party that is registered to act as a broker or a dealer, or both, in securities transactions

Name: Broker Role
Comment: Role of a party that is registered to act as a broker or a dealer, or both, in securities transactions, specifically as a party that executes orders on behalf of clients

Name: Budget
Comment: Financial plan for a defined period, typically a year, that describes how resources will be allocated and spent

Name: Budgetary Allocation
Comment: Amount of funds assigned to a specific purpose or activity within a budget

Name: Budgetary Component
Comment: A portion or sub-category within a financial budget, used for allocation and tracking

Name: Business Activity
Comment: An action or set of actions undertaken by an organization to achieve an economic goal or other stated purpose

Name: Business Address
Comment: A specific location where a business is conducted or where legal correspondence and official documents can be delivered

Name: Business Continuity Plan
Comment: A plan that outlines procedures and instructions an organization must follow in the face of disaster or business disruption to ensure essential functions continue

Name: Business Day
Comment: A day (typically Monday through Friday) during which normal business is conducted, excluding weekends and public holidays

Name: Business Entity
Comment: An organization formed to conduct business, engage in commerce, or carry out a mission, whether for-profit or not-for-profit

Name: Business Event
Comment: Something that happens during the course of business, which may be internal or external, and which may or may not require a response

Name: Business Hours
Comment: The specific period of time during a day when a business is open and conducting its regular operations

Name: Business Identifier
Comment: A unique code or number assigned to a legal entity to identify it in various business or legal contexts

Name: Business Legal Name
Comment: The official and registered full name of a business entity

Name: Business Location
Comment: The physical site or address where a business entity operates or is registered to operate

Name: Business Model
Comment: The conceptual structure supporting the viability of a business, including its purpose, processes, technology, and finances

Name: Business Process
Comment: A collection of related, structured activities or tasks that produce a specific service or product for a particular customer or market

Name: Business Purpose
Comment: The stated reason or objective for which a business entity is formed and operates

Name: Business Relationship
Comment: A formal or informal connection or arrangement between two or more business entities for mutual benefit or to conduct a transaction

Name: Business Sector
Comment: A broad classification of economic activity grouping companies that are similar in the product or service they provide

Name: Buyer
Comment: The party acquiring goods, services, or assets in a transaction

Name: Call Date
Comment: The date on which an issuer of a callable security can choose to redeem the security before its maturity date

Name: Call Option
Comment: An option contract that gives the holder the right, but not the obligation, to buy an underlying asset at a specified price (strike price) on or before a specified date (expiration date)

Name: Callable Bond
Comment: A bond that the issuer may redeem before its stated maturity date

Name: Callable Swap
Comment: A swap contract where one of the counterparties has the option, but not the obligation, to terminate the swap on a specified call date(s)

Name: Capability
Comment: The ability of an organization or system to perform a specific action or produce an intended outcome

Name: Capacity (acty)
Comment: The potential ability to execute an action or fulfill a role, often measured by resources or competence

Name: Capacity (fnd)
Comment: The maximum output or volume that a process, asset, or entity can sustain over a period of time

Name: Capital
Comment: Financial assets, funds, or resources available for use in a business or project

Name: Capital Adequacy
Comment: The amount of capital a bank or other financial institution holds relative to its risk-weighted assets to ensure its financial stability

Name: Capital Asset
Comment: An asset with a useful life of more than one year that is not intended for sale in the regular course of the business's operation

Name: Capital Gain
Comment: The profit earned on the sale of a capital asset that was held for more than a specified period

Name: Capital Goods
Comment: Physical assets that a company uses in the production process to manufacture products or provide services

Name: Capital Instrument
Comment: A financial security issued by a company to raise capital, such as common stock, preferred stock, or bonds

Name: Capital Protection Certificate
Comment: An investment product designed to provide a guaranteed return of the principal amount invested (or a large percentage of it) at maturity

Name: Capital Requirement
Comment: The minimum amount of capital that financial institutions are required to hold by regulatory authorities

Name: Capital Stock
Comment: The total amount of stock a corporation is authorized to issue, as specified in its corporate charter

Name: Capitalization
Comment: The total amount of money raised by a company by issuing debt and/or equity

Name: Career
Comment: An occupation undertaken for a significant period of a person's life and with opportunities for progress

Name: Career Path
Comment: A sequence of jobs that constitute a person's career progression in an industry or field

Name: Carry Trade
Comment: A trading strategy that involves borrowing at a low interest rate and investing in an asset that provides a higher rate of return

Name: Cash
Comment: Currency (banknotes and coins) held by an individual or organization, or money available in a bank account

Name: Cash Account
Comment: An investment account where all transactions must be settled with cash in the account, as opposed to a margin account

Name: Cash Asset
Comment: An asset that is cash or can be quickly converted into cash with minimal loss of value

Name: Cash Collateral
Comment: Cash or cash equivalents pledged by a borrower to a lender to secure a loan or margin requirement

Name: Cash Deposit
Comment: The act of placing cash into a bank account or similar financial holding

Name: Cash Dividend
Comment: A payment made by a corporation to its shareholders in the form of cash

Name: Cash Flow
Comment: The total amount of money being transferred into and out of a business, especially as affecting liquidity

Name: Cash Future
Comment: A futures contract that is settled with a cash payment rather than the physical delivery of the underlying asset

Name: Cash Settlement
Comment: The process of settling a financial contract, such as a derivative, with a net cash payment rather than the physical delivery of the underlying asset

Name: Central Bank
Comment: An independent national authority that issues currency, manages the money supply, and controls the country's monetary policy

Name: Central Counterparty
Comment: An entity that interposes itself between counterparties to contracts traded in one or more financial markets, becoming the buyer to every seller and the seller to every buyer

Name: Central Repository
Comment: A central database or storage location for data, often used for regulatory reporting or trade data

Name: Certificate
Comment: A document attesting to a fact, qualification, or promise

Name: Certificate Of Deposit
Comment: A time deposit that earns a specified interest rate over a fixed period and is typically issued by a bank

Name: Certified Document
Comment: A copy of a document that is formally guaranteed to be a true and accurate copy of the original

Name: Certified Public Accountant
Comment: A professional designation for accountants who have met state licensing requirements, including exams and experience

Name: Change Event
Comment: An event that marks a significant shift or alteration in the state, condition, or structure of an entity or process

Name: Characteristic
Comment: An inherent or distinguishing feature or quality of a thing

Name: Characteristic Value
Comment: The specific data or measure associated with a characteristic

Name: Charter
Comment: A legal document that establishes a corporation, city, university, or other organization and defines its mission and structure

Name: Chief Executive Officer
Comment: The highest-ranking executive in a company, responsible for making major corporate decisions, managing the overall operations and resources of a company, and acting as the main point of communication between the board of directors and corporate operations

Name: Chief Financial Officer
Comment: The corporate officer primarily responsible for managing the financial risks of the corporation, financial planning, and financial reporting

Name: Child
Comment: A young human being below the age of full legal responsibility

Name: Citizenship
Comment: The status of being a legally recognized member of a country, state, or commonwealth

Name: Claim
Comment: A formal request by a party to an insurer, debtor, or other party for payment or compensation under the terms of a contract

Name: Claim Type
Comment: A classification of a claim based on the nature of the alleged damage, loss, or obligation

Name: Classification
Comment: A grouping or sorting of things according to a system or set of criteria

Name: Classification Scheme
Comment: A systematic arrangement or structure for grouping items or concepts based on shared characteristics

Name: Classifier
Comment: An entity used to categorize or assign a class to another entity based on some characteristic or rule

Name: Clearing House
Comment: A financial institution that acts as an intermediary and assumes the role of matching and guaranteeing trades between a buyer and a seller

Name: Client
Comment: A party that purchases goods or services from another party

Name: Client Account
Comment: An account held by a service provider on behalf of a client to manage their assets or transactions

Name: Close-End Fund
Comment: A type of mutual fund that issues a fixed number of shares via an IPO and then trades them on a stock exchange

Name: Close-Out Netting
Comment: A provision in a master agreement that requires all obligations between two parties to be netted to a single, final payment upon a default or termination event

Name: Closed Market
Comment: A financial market that is not currently open for trading

Name: Closed-End Mortgage
Comment: A mortgage agreement that prevents the borrower from taking out additional funds against the property

Name: Closing Date
Comment: The date on which the sale of a property or the finalization of a financial transaction is legally completed

Name: Closing Price
Comment: The final price at which a security is traded on a given day

Name: Collateral
Comment: An asset or property pledged by a borrower to a lender to secure a loan; it may be seized by the lender if the borrower defaults

Name: Collateral Agreement
Comment: A legal contract documenting the terms under which collateral is provided to secure a financial obligation

Name: Collateral Manager
Comment: A party responsible for managing the collateral securing a structured finance transaction, such as a CLO or CDO

Name: Collateralized Debt Obligation
Comment: A complex structured finance product backed by a pool of assets, such as loans, bonds, or other debt instruments

Name: Collateralized Loan Obligation
Comment: A type of CDO that is backed by a pool of corporate loans

Name: Collection Agency
Comment: A business that specializes in collecting debts for creditors

Name: Commercial Bank
Comment: A financial institution that accepts deposits, offers checking account services, makes various loans, and offers basic financial products

Name: Commercial Paper
Comment: A short-term, unsecured debt instrument issued by large corporations to raise funds to meet short-term liabilities

Name: Commercial Property
Comment: Real estate used for business activities, such as office buildings, retail centers, or industrial warehouses

Name: Commission
Comment: A fee charged by a broker or agent for executing a trade or transaction on behalf of a client

Name: Commodity
Comment: A raw material or primary agricultural product that can be bought and sold, such as gold, oil, or coffee

Name: Commodity Exchange
Comment: A market where contracts for the future delivery of physical commodities or financial derivatives based on them are bought and sold

Name: Commodity Futures Contract
Comment: A futures contract where the underlying asset is a physical commodity

Name: Commodity Option
Comment: An option contract where the underlying asset is a commodity or a commodity future

Name: Common Carrier
Comment: A person or company that transports goods or people for a fee and is available to the general public

Name: Common Stock
Comment: A security that represents ownership in a corporation; holders typically have voting rights and are entitled to a share of the company's profits

Name: Communication Address
Comment: An address used for transmitting information, which can be physical (postal) or electronic (email)

Name: Communication Channel
Comment: The medium or pathway through which information is transmitted from a sender to a receiver

Name: Community Development Bank
Comment: A financial institution focused on serving low- to moderate-income communities that have historically been underserved by conventional banks

Name: Company
Comment: A legal entity formed by a group of people to engage in and operate a business (commercial or industrial) enterprise

Name: Compensatory Damage
Comment: Money awarded to a plaintiff to compensate for actual loss or injury suffered

Name: Competent Authority
Comment: An official or government body that has the legally delegated authority to issue a permit, license, or perform a regulatory function

Name: Complaint
Comment: A formal statement alleging a grievance or wrong, typically filed with a regulatory body or in a court of law

Name: Compliance Requirement
Comment: A rule, regulation, or law that a business must adhere to, often enforced by a governing body

Name: Component
Comment: A distinct part of a larger system or whole

Name: Composite Index
Comment: A market index that is constructed by combining the components of several other indices

Name: Comprehensive Income
Comment: A measure of an entity's change in equity during a period from transactions and other events from non-owner sources

Name: Compromise
Comment: An agreement or a settlement of a dispute that is reached by each side making concessions

Name: Compound Interest
Comment: Interest calculated on the initial principal and also on the accumulated interest of previous periods

Name: Concentration Limit
Comment: A constraint imposed on the maximum exposure an entity can have to a single counterparty, industry, or asset class to mitigate risk

Name: Condition
Comment: A state of being or a prerequisite that must be met

Name: Conflict Of Interest
Comment: A situation in which a person or organization has competing professional or personal interests that could make it difficult to fulfill their duties impartially

Name: Consent
Comment: A voluntary agreement to a proposition or action

Name: Consent Order
Comment: A legally binding agreement between a government agency (regulator) and a company or individual that resolves a regulatory dispute without admission of guilt

Name: Constitutional Document
Comment: A foundational legal document that establishes the existence, structure, and operational rules of a legal entity, such as Articles of Incorporation or a Charter

Name: Constitutional Right
Comment: A right guaranteed to citizens by the constitution of a country or state

Name: Consumer
Comment: A party that purchases goods and services for personal use rather than for manufacture or resale

Name: Consumer Price Index
Comment: A measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services

Name: Contact Information
Comment: Data used to communicate with a party, such as a phone number, email address, or postal address

Name: Contact Point
Comment: A specific individual or department designated for communication within an organization

Name: Contingency Plan
Comment: A plan designed to take a possible future event or circumstance into account, especially a plan B for a possible disaster

Name: Contingent Obligation
Comment: An obligation that is conditional on the occurrence or non-occurrence of one or more future events

Name: Continuation Option
Comment: A clause in an insurance or financial contract that gives a party the right to extend the agreement under certain conditions

Name: Contract
Comment: A legally binding agreement between two or more parties that defines their rights and obligations

Name: Contract Date
Comment: The date on which a contract is formally executed or becomes legally effective

Name: Contract Maturity Date
Comment: The date on which the obligations of a contract are set to expire or be fully fulfilled

Name: Contract Terms
Comment: The specific conditions and stipulations that govern the rights and obligations of the parties to a contract

Name: Contractual Agreement
Comment: A mutual agreement between two or more parties that is legally binding

Name: Control
Comment: The power to direct the management and policies of a business entity

Name: Control Agreement
Comment: A legal agreement that establishes the rights of a secured party over a debtor's assets, often used in secured transactions

Name: Control Event
Comment: An event that triggers a change in the ability of a party to control or direct an entity's policies and management

Name: Control Right
Comment: The legal right of a party to influence or direct the management, policies, and actions of another entity

Name: Controlled Entity
Comment: A legal entity over which another entity exercises control, typically through ownership of a majority of voting shares

Name: Controller
Comment: The party that exercises control over another entity

Name: Controlling Interest
Comment: A sufficient percentage of voting stock in a corporation to influence or control the company's management

Name: Conventional Mortgage
Comment: A home loan that is not guaranteed or insured by a government agency like the FHA or VA

Name: Conversion Feature
Comment: A provision in a security that allows the holder to exchange it for another form of security, typically common stock

Name: Conversion Ratio
Comment: The number of shares of a new security that an investor will receive for each convertible security they hold

Name: Convertible Bond
Comment: A bond that can be converted into a predetermined amount of the issuer's common stock at the holder's option

Name: Convertible Preferred Stock
Comment: Preferred stock that includes an option for the holder to convert it into a fixed number of common shares

Name: Corporate Action
Comment: An event initiated by a corporation that affects its issued securities and stakeholders

Name: Corporate Bond
Comment: A debt security issued by a corporation to raise capital

Name: Corporate Charter
Comment: The foundational legal document that establishes a corporation's existence and defines its structure and powers

Name: Corporate Governance
Comment: The system of rules, practices, and processes by which a company is directed and controlled

Name: Corporate Head Office
Comment: The primary location where a company's executive and administrative functions are concentrated

Name: Corporation
Comment: A legal entity separate from its owners, created under the laws of a specific jurisdiction

Name: Cost
Comment: The monetary value of resources consumed to produce goods or services

Name: Cost Of Capital
Comment: The required rate of return that a company must earn on its existing asset base to maintain the current value of its securities

Name: Cost Of Goods Sold
Comment: The direct costs attributable to the production of the goods sold by a company

Name: Counterparty
Comment: A party involved in a financial transaction

Name: Counterparty Credit Risk
Comment: The risk that a counterparty to a financial transaction will default on its obligations

Name: Country
Comment: A sovereign state or a political territory with a defined geographic boundary

Name: Country Code
Comment: A short alphabetic or numeric code used to uniquely identify a country

Name: Coupon
Comment: The periodic interest payment made by the issuer of a debt security to the holder

Name: Coupon Date
Comment: The specific date on which an interest payment (coupon) is due to the bondholder

Name: Coupon Frequency
Comment: The number of times per year that a coupon payment is made

Name: Covenant
Comment: A formal agreement or promise, often legally binding, included in a loan or bond agreement

Name: Credit Agency
Comment: An organization that collects credit information about consumers and businesses and sells it to creditors in the form of credit reports

Name: Credit Default Swap
Comment: A financial derivative that allows one party to swap the credit risk of a reference entity with another party

Name: Credit Event
Comment: An event, such as bankruptcy or failure to pay, that triggers a payout under a Credit Default Swap contract

Name: Credit Facility
Comment: A type of loan or financing arrangement that allows a business to borrow funds up to a certain limit

Name: Credit Rating
Comment: An assessment of the creditworthiness of a borrower in general or with respect to a specific debt or financial obligation

Name: Credit Risk
Comment: The potential that a borrower will default on a debt obligation

Name: Credit Union
Comment: A non-profit financial cooperative owned by its members, which offers financial services similar to a bank

Name: Currency
Comment: A medium of exchange, such as banknotes and coins, typically issued by a government

Name: Currency Exchange Rate
Comment: The rate at which one currency will be exchanged for another

Name: Currency Pair
Comment: A quotation of the exchange rate for two different currencies, such as EUR/USD

Name: Currency Swap
Comment: A swap in which the two parties exchange principal and interest payments in different currencies

Name: Customer
Comment: A party who receives a service or product from a seller or service provider

Name: Custodian
Comment: A financial institution that holds a customer's securities for safekeeping to minimize the risk of theft or loss

Name: Custodian Bank
Comment: A bank specializing in acting as a custodian for investment funds and institutional investors

Name: Custody Agreement
Comment: A legal contract that defines the terms under which a custodian will hold and manage a client's assets

Name: Data Element
Comment: A unit of data that is considered indivisible for the purpose of a particular analysis

Name: Data Model
Comment: An abstract model that organizes elements of data and standardizes how they relate to one another

Name: Date
Comment: A particular day, month, and year

Name: Date Of Birth
Comment: The day, month, and year a person was born

Name: Date Of Death
Comment: The day, month, and year a person passed away

Name: Dealer
Comment: A party that stands ready to buy or sell securities for its own account, acting as a principal in a transaction

Name: Dealer Role
Comment: The capacity in which a party acts as a principal in a securities transaction, trading from its own inventory

Name: Debt
Comment: An obligation that requires one party (the debtor) to pay money or transfer other agreed-upon value to another party (the creditor)

Name: Debt Instrument
Comment: A financial security representing a loan that an issuer must repay to the holder

Name: Debt Obligation
Comment: A specific requirement to repay a debt, often defined by a schedule and set of terms

Name: Debt Pool
Comment: A collection of various debt instruments grouped together, often used as the underlying assets for a structured finance product

Name: Debt Security
Comment: A fungible, negotiable financial instrument representing a debt

Name: Debtor
Comment: The party that owes a debt or is under a financial obligation to another party

Name: Decision
Comment: A choice made after considering the available options

Name: Decision Maker
Comment: The person or entity responsible for making a decision

Name: Decision Point
Comment: A specific moment or stage in a process where a choice must be made

Name: Deed
Comment: A legal document that is signed and delivered, especially one regarding the ownership of property or legal rights

Name: Default
Comment: A failure to meet the legal obligations (or terms) of a loan, such as when a borrower fails to make a required interest or principal payment

Name: Default Risk
Comment: The risk of loss due to a debtor's failure to repay a loan or meet contractual obligations

Name: Deferred Compensation
Comment: A portion of an employee's salary or bonus that is paid out at a later date

Name: Deferred Interest Bond
Comment: A bond that allows the issuer to defer or postpone interest payments for a specified period

Name: Defined Benefit Plan
Comment: A retirement plan where an employer guarantees a specific monthly benefit to the employee upon retirement

Name: Defined Contribution Plan
Comment: A retirement plan where the benefit is not guaranteed; the final payout depends on the contributions made and the investment performance

Name: Degree
Comment: An academic title conferred by a college or university for the successful completion of a course of study

Name: Delivery Obligation
Comment: The legal requirement to physically deliver an asset as specified in a contract, such as a futures contract

Name: Delivery Point
Comment: The specified location where a physical asset must be delivered to settle a contract

Name: Demand Deposit
Comment: A bank account (like a checking account) from which funds can be withdrawn at any time without advance notice

Name: Denomination
Comment: The face value or unit amount of a currency, security, or other financial instrument

Name: Dependent Child
Comment: A child who relies on another person (parent or guardian) for financial support

Name: Deposit Account
Comment: An account held at a financial institution where funds are placed for safekeeping and can be withdrawn under certain conditions

Name: Depository Institution
Comment: A financial institution (like a bank or credit union) that is legally permitted to accept monetary deposits from the public

Name: Depreciation
Comment: A reduction in the value of an asset over time, due in particular to wear and tear

Name: Derivative
Comment: A financial instrument whose value is derived from an underlying asset, rate, or index

Name: Derivative Contract
Comment: A legal agreement that defines the terms of a derivative transaction

Name: Designated Contract Market
Comment: A board of trade that is registered with the CFTC and allows for the trading of futures and options on futures contracts

Name: Designated Investment Company
Comment: A classification for certain pooled investment vehicles under regulatory law

Name: Director
Comment: A person who is part of the governing body (Board of Directors) of a corporation

Name: Disability
Comment: A physical or mental condition that limits a person's movements, senses, or activities

Name: Disclosure
Comment: The act of making information known, especially information that is legally required to be revealed

Name: Discount Rate
Comment: The interest rate charged to commercial banks and other depository institutions on loans they receive from their regional Federal Reserve Bank's lending facility

Name: Discounted Cash Flow
Comment: A valuation method used to estimate the value of an investment based on its expected future cash flows

Name: Disbursement
Comment: The action of paying out money

Name: Distribution
Comment: The act of distributing assets, income, or securities to shareholders or beneficiaries

Name: Distribution Right
Comment: The legal right of a shareholder to receive a share of a corporation's earnings or assets

Name: Dividend
Comment: A payment made by a corporation to its shareholders, usually as a distribution of profits

Name: Dividend Date
Comment: The date on which a dividend payment is scheduled to be made to shareholders

Name: Dividend Rate
Comment: The amount of the dividend payment expressed as an annual percentage of the security's par value

Name: Document
Comment: A written or electronic record that contains official or factual information
